children.text: These are the people of the province who went up from the captivity of those who were exiled, whom King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had carried away to Babylon, and who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, each to his city.
They came with Zerubbabel, Joshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, and Baanah.
This is the number of the men of the people of Israel.
The sons of Parosh: two thousand one hundred and seventy two.
The sons of Shephatiah: undefined.
The sons of Arah: undefined.
The sons of Pahath- Moab, the sons of Jeshua and Joab: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Elam: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Zattu: undefined.
The sons of Zakkai: undefined.
The sons of Bani: undefined.
The sons of Bebai: undefined.
The sons of Azgad: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Adonikam: undefined.
The sons of Bigvai: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Adin: undefined.
The sons of Ater, through Hezekiah: ninety- eight.
The sons of Bezai: undefined.
The sons of Jorah: undefined.
The sons of Hashum: undefined.
The sons of Gibbar: ninety- five.
The sons of Bethlehem: undefined.
The men of Netophah: fifty- six.
The men of Anathoth: undefined.
The sons of Azmaveth: forty- two.
The sons of Kiriath Arim, Kephirah, and Beeroth: undefined.
The sons of Ramah and Geba: undefined.
The men of Michmas: undefined.
The men of Bethel and Ai: undefined.
The sons of Nebo: fifty- two.
The sons of Magbish: undefined.
The sons of the other Elam: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Harim: undefined.
The sons of Lod, Hadid, and Ono: undefined.
The sons of Jericho: undefined.
The sons of Senaah: undefined, undefined.
The priests: sons of Jedaiah of the house of Jeshua: undefined.
The sons of Immer: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Pashhur: undefined, undefined.
The sons of Harim: undefined, undefined.
The Levites: sons of Jeshua and Kadmiel, sons of Hodaviah: seventy- four.
The temple singers, sons of Asaph: undefined.
The sons of the gatekeepers: sons of Shallum, sons of Ater, sons of Talmon, sons of Akkub, sons of Hatita, and sons of Shobai: undefined in all.
The temple servants: sons of Ziha, sons of Hasupha, sons of Tabbaoth,
sons of Keros, sons of Siaha, sons of Padon,
sons of Lebanah, sons of Hagabah, sons of Akkub,
sons of Hagab, sons of Shalmai, and sons of Hanan.
The sons of Giddel: sons of Gahar, sons of Reaiah,
sons of Rezin, sons of Nekoda, sons of Gazzam,
sons of Uzza, sons of Paseah, sons of Besai,
sons of Asnah, sons of Meunim, and sons of Nephusim.
The sons of Bakbuk: sons of Hakupha, sons of Harhur,
sons of Bazluth, sons of Mehida, sons of Harsha,
sons of Barkos, sons of Sisera, sons of Temah,
sons of Neziah, and sons of Hatipha.
The sons of the servants of Solomon: sons of Sotai, sons of Hassophereth, sons of Peruda,
sons of Jaalah, sons of Darkon, sons of Giddel,
sons of Shephatiah, sons of Hattil, sons of Pochereth Hazzebaim, and sons of Ami.
All the temple servants and the sons of the servants of Solomon: undefined.
These were those who came from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Kerub, Addon, and Immer— but they could not prove the house of their father or their ancestry, whether they were from Israel—
sons of Delaiah, sons of Tobiah, and sons of Nekoda: undefined.
The sons of the priests: sons of Habaiah, sons of Hakkoz, and sons of Barzillai( who took a wife from the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called by their name).
These searched for the records of their ancestry, but they were not found, so they were excluded from the priesthood as defiled.
So the governor said to them that they must not eat from the most holy food until a priest could consult with the Urim and Thummim.
The whole group totaled undefined, undefined,
not including their servants and their maidservants( these were undefined, undefined) and they had male and female temple singers( two hundred).
Their horses: undefined. Their mules: undefined.
Their camels: undefined. Their donkeys: undefined, undefined.
When the heads of the father’ s houses came to the house of Yahweh which is in Jerusalem, they freely offered gifts to build the house of God on its site.
They gave according to their ability to the treasure for the work: undefined. undefined gold darics, five thousand silver minas, and one hundred priestly tunics.
So the priests, and the Levites, and some of the people, and the singers, and the gatekeepers, and the temple servants lived in their cities, and all israel lived in their cities.
